title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: get_administration_data() function gives -administration information, either specific language /form instruments.

title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: get_item_data() function gives -item information, either specific language /form instruments.
code: get_item_data(language = "Italian", form = "WG") ## # A tibble: 505 × 12 ##    item_id item_…¹ item_…² engli…³ langu…⁴ form  form_…⁵ categ…⁶ lexic…⁷ lexic…⁸ ##    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ##  1 item_1  first_… Rispon… Respon… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  2 item_2  first_… Rispon… Respon… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  3 item_3  first_… Reagis… Look f… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  4 item_4  phrases Vuoi l… Are yo… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  5 item_5  phrases Hai so… Are yo… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  6 item_6  phrases Vuoi b… Do you… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  7 item_7  phrases Stai a… Be car… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  8 item_8  phrases Stai b… NA      Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  9 item_9  phrases Batti … Clap y… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ## 10 item_10 phrases Cambia… Change… Italian WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ## # … with 495 more rows, 2 more variables: complexity_category <chr>, ## #   uni_lemma <chr>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​item_kind, ## #   ²​item_definition, ³​english_gloss, ⁴​language, ⁵​form_type, ⁶​category, ## #   ⁷​lexical_category, ⁸​lexical_class ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names get_item_data() ## # A tibble: 40,959 × 12 ##    item_id item_…¹ item_…² engli…³ langu…⁴ form  form_…⁵ categ…⁶ lexic…⁷ lexic…⁸ ##    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ##  1 item_1  phrases be car… be car… Britis… WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  2 item_2  phrases bring … bring … Britis… WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  3 item_3  phrases change… change… Britis… WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ##  4 item_4  phrases come h… come h… Britis… WG    WG      NA      NA      NA      ## # … with 40,949 more rows, 2 more variables: complexity_category <chr>, ## #   uni_lemma <chr>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​item_kind, ## #   ²​item_definition, ³​english_gloss, ⁴​language, ⁵​form_type, ⁶​category, ## title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: looking total vocabulary size, admins need, since productive receptive vocabulary sizes calculated. looking specific items subsets items, need load instrument data, using get_instrument_data() function. Pass instrument language form, along list items want extract (item_id). default get_instrument_table() returns data frame columns administration’s data_id, item’s num_item_id (numerical item_id), corresponding value. include administration information, can set administrations argument TRUE, pass result get_administration_data() administrations (way can prevent administration data loaded multiple times). Similarly, can set iteminfo argument TRUE, pass result get_item_data(). Loading data fast need handful items, time scales linearly number items, can get quite slow need many . , ’s good idea filter items need calling get_instrument_data(). example, let’s say want look production animal words English Words & Sentences age. First get items want: get instrument data items: Finally, calculate many animals words child produces median number animals age bin:
code: get_instrument_data(   language = "English (American)",   form = "WS",   items = c("item_26", "item_46") ) ## # A tibble: 17,098 × 5 ##    data_id item_id value      produces understands ##      <dbl> <chr>   <chr>      <lgl>    <lgl>       ##  1  245518 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ##  2  245519 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ##  3  245520 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ##  4  245521 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ##  5  245522 item_26 ""         FALSE    FALSE       ##  6  245523 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ##  7  245524 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ##  8  245525 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ##  9  245526 item_26 "produces" TRUE     TRUE        ## 10  245527 item_26 ""         FALSE    FALSE       ## # … with 17,088 more rows ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows animals <- get_item_data(language = "English (American)", form = "WS") %>%   filter(category == "animals") animal_data <- get_instrument_data(language = "English (American)",                                    form = "WS",                                    items = animals$item_id,                                    administration_info = TRUE) animal_summary <- animal_data %>%   # mutate(produces = value == "produces") %>%   group_by(age, data_id) %>%   summarise(num_animals = sum(produces, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   group_by(age) %>%   summarise(median_num_animals = median(num_animals, na.rm = TRUE))    ggplot(animal_summary, aes(x = age, y = median_num_animals)) +   geom_point() +   labs(x = "Age (months)", y = "Median animal words producing")

title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: get_instruments() function gives information CDI instruments Wordbank.
code: get_instruments() ## # A tibble: 78 × 8 ##    instrument_id language          form  form_…¹ age_min age_max has_g…² unile…³ ##            <int> <chr>             <chr> <chr>     <int>   <int>   <int>   <dbl> ##  1             1 British Sign Lan… WG    WG            8      36       0       1 ##  2             2 Cantonese         WS    WS           16      30       0       1 ##  3             3 Croatian          WG    WG            8      16       0       1 ##  4             4 Croatian          WS    WS           16      30       0       1 ##  5             5 Danish            WG    WG            8      20       0       1 ##  6             6 Danish            WS    WS           16      36       1       1 ##  7             7 English (America… WG    WG            8      18       0       1 ##  8             8 English (America… WS    WS           16      30       1       1 ##  9             9 French (Quebecoi… WG    WG            8      16       0       1 ## 10            10 French (Quebecoi… WS    WS           16      30       1       1 ## # … with 68 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​form_type, ²​has_grammar, ## #   ³​unilemma_coverage ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: get_datasets() function gives information datasets Wordbank, either specific language /form instruments. admin_data argument set TRUE, results also include number administrations database dataset.
code: get_datasets(form = "WG") ## # A tibble: 37 × 10 ##    datas…¹ datas…² datas…³ contr…⁴ citat…⁵ license longi…⁶ langu…⁷ form  form_…⁸ ##      <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <lgl>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>   ##  1       5 Marchm… Marchm… Larry … "Fenso… CC-BY   FALSE   Englis… WG    WG      ##  2       6 Byers   Byers_… Krista… ""      CC-BY   FALSE   Englis… WG    WG      ##  3       7 Thal    Thal    Donna … "Thal,… CC-BY   TRUE    Englis… WG    WG      ##  4       9 Marchm… Marchm… Donna … "Jacks… CC-BY   FALSE   Spanis… WG    WG      ##  5      12 Kristo… Kristo… Hanne … "Simon… CC-BY   TRUE    Norweg… WG    WG      ##  6      13 CLEX    CLEX__… Melita… "Kovac… CC-BY   FALSE   Croati… WG    WG      ##  7      17 CLEX    CLEX__… Stella… "Е.А.В… CC-BY   FALSE   Russian WG    WG      ##  8      19 CLEX    CLEX__… Mårten… "Eriks… CC-BY   FALSE   Swedish WG    WG      ##  9      21 CLEX    CLEX__… Aylin … "Acarl… CC-BY   FALSE   Turkish WG    WG      ## 10      23 Shalev  Shalev… Hila G… "Gendl… CC-BY   FALSE   Hebrew  WG    WG      ## # … with 27 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​dataset_id, ## #   ²​dataset_name, ³​dataset_origin_name, ⁴​contributor, ⁵​citation, ## #   ⁶​longitudinal, ⁷​language, ⁸​form_type ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows get_datasets(language = "Spanish (Mexican)", admin_data = TRUE) ## # A tibble: 6 × 11 ##   datase…¹ datas…² datas…³ contr…⁴ citat…⁵ license longi…⁶ langu…⁷ form  form_…⁸ ##      <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <lgl>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>   ## 1        8 Marchm… Marchm… Donna … Marchm… CC-BY   FALSE   Spanis… WS    WS      ## 2        9 Marchm… Marchm… Donna … Jackso… CC-BY   FALSE   Spanis… WG    WG      ## 3       55 Fernald Fernal… Anne F… Weisle… CC-BY   TRUE    Spanis… WG    WG      ## 4       56 Fernald Fernal… Anne F… Weisle… CC-BY   TRUE    Spanis… WS    WS      ## 5       76 Marchm… Marchm… Donna … Jackso… CC-BY   FALSE   Spanis… WS    WS      ## 6       87 Hoff    Hoff_E… Hoff, E Hoff, … CC-BY   TRUE    Spanis… WS    WS      ## # … with 1 more variable: n_admins <dbl>, and abbreviated variable names ## #   ¹​dataset_id, ²​dataset_name, ³​dataset_origin_name, ⁴​contributor, ⁵​citation, ## #   ⁶​longitudinal, ⁷​language, ⁸​form_type ## # ℹ Use `colnames()` to see all variable names

title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: fit_aoa() function computes estimates items’ age acquisition (AoA). needs provided data frame returned get_instrument_data() – one row per administration x item combination, minimally columns age num_item_id. returns data frame one row per item aoa column estimate, preserving item-level columns input data. AoA estimated computing proportion administrations child understands/produces (measure) word, smoothing proportion using method, taking age smoothed value greater proportion.
code: eng_ws_data <- get_instrument_data(language = "English (American)",                                    form = "WS",                                    items = c("item_1", "item_42"),                                    administration_info = TRUE,                                    item_info = TRUE) fit_aoa(eng_ws_data) ## # A tibble: 2 × 9 ##     aoa item_id item_kind item_definit…¹ categ…² lexic…³ lexic…⁴ uni_l…⁵ compl…⁶ ##   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>     <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ## 1    NA item_1  word      baa baa        sounds  other   other   baa baa NA      ## 2    24 item_42 word      owl            animals nouns   nouns   owl     NA      ## # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​item_definition, ²​category, ## #   ³​lexical_category, ⁴​lexical_class, ⁵​uni_lemma, ⁶​complexity_category fit_aoa(eng_ws_data, measure = "understands", method = "glmrob", proportion = 0.7) ## # A tibble: 2 × 9 ##     aoa item_id item_kind item_definit…¹ categ…² lexic…³ lexic…⁴ uni_l…⁵ compl…⁶ ##   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>     <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ## 1    22 item_1  word      baa baa        sounds  other   other   baa baa NA      ## 2    28 item_42 word      owl            animals nouns   nouns   owl     NA      ## # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​item_definition, ²​category, ## #   ³​lexical_category, ⁴​lexical_class, ⁵​uni_lemma, ⁶​complexity_category

title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: One item-level fields uni_lemma (“universal lemma”), intended approximate semantic mapping words across languages Wordbank. function get_crossling_items() simply gives available uni_lemma values. function get_crossling_data() takes vector uni_lemmas returns data frame summary statistics item mapped uni_lemma language (WG forms). row combination item age, columns indicate number children (n_children), means (comprehension, production), standard deviations (comprehension_sd, production_sd), item-level fields.
code: get_crossling_items() ## # A tibble: 2,552 × 2 ##       id uni_lemma                 ##    <int> <chr>                     ##  1  1739 (hair)brush               ##  2  1552 (play)pen                 ##  3  1494 (sheep)                   ##  4  1783 (to be in) pain           ##  5  1777 (to be) hungry            ##  6  1775 (to be) thirsty           ##  7  1769 (to have) breakfast       ##  8  1272 [possessive]              ##  9  1593 [to splash in the water?] ## 10  1951 1PL                       ## # … with 2,542 more rows ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows get_crossling_data(uni_lemmas = c("hat", "nose")) %>%   select(language, uni_lemma, item_definition, age, n_children, comprehension,          production, comprehension_sd, production_sd) %>%   arrange(uni_lemma)

title: Accessing the Wordbank database
text: function fit_vocab_quantiles() uses quantile regression fit set vocabulary size quantiles dataset. takes data frame return get_administration_data(), additional arguments specifying measure column fit (measure: “production” “comprehension”), optional demographic column group (group), type quantiles fit (quantiles: “standard”, “deciles”, “quintiles”, “quartiles”, “median”, numeric vector quantile values). Defaults “standard”, 0.10, 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 0.90.
code: eng_ws <- get_administration_data("English (American)", "WS",                                   include_demographic_info = TRUE) fit_vocab_quantiles(eng_ws, production) ## # A tibble: 75 × 5 ##    language           form    age quantile production ##    <chr>              <chr> <int> <fct>         <dbl> ##  1 English (American) WS       16 0.1          -11.4  ##  2 English (American) WS       17 0.1           -3.46 ##  3 English (American) WS       18 0.1            5.01 ##  4 English (American) WS       19 0.1           14.0  ##  5 English (American) WS       20 0.1           23.5  ##  6 English (American) WS       21 0.1           33.5  ##  7 English (American) WS       22 0.1           44.0  ##  8 English (American) WS       23 0.1           55.1  ##  9 English (American) WS       24 0.1           66.6  ## 10 English (American) WS       25 0.1           78.7  ## # … with 65 more rows ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows fit_vocab_quantiles(eng_ws, production, sex) ## # A tibble: 150 × 6 ##    language           form  sex      age quantile production ##    <chr>              <chr> <fct>  <int> <fct>         <dbl> ##  1 English (American) WS    Female    16 0.1          -19.5  ##  2 English (American) WS    Female    17 0.1           -7.64 ##  3 English (American) WS    Female    18 0.1            4.52 ##  4 English (American) WS    Female    19 0.1           17.0  ##  5 English (American) WS    Female    20 0.1           29.8  ##  6 English (American) WS    Female    21 0.1           42.9  ##  7 English (American) WS    Female    22 0.1           56.4  ##  8 English (American) WS    Female    23 0.1           70.2  ##  9 English (American) WS    Female    24 0.1           84.3  ## 10 English (American) WS    Female    25 0.1           98.7  ## # … with 140 more rows ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows fit_vocab_quantiles(eng_ws, production, quantiles = "quartiles") ## # A tibble: 45 × 5 ##    language           form    age quantile production ##    <chr>              <chr> <int> <fct>         <dbl> ##  1 English (American) WS       16 0.25          -6.86 ##  2 English (American) WS       17 0.25           5.52 ##  3 English (American) WS       18 0.25          20.0  ##  4 English (American) WS       19 0.25          36.6  ##  5 English (American) WS       20 0.25          55.3  ##  6 English (American) WS       21 0.25          76.1  ##  7 English (American) WS       22 0.25          99.0  ##  8 English (American) WS       23 0.25         124.   ##  9 English (American) WS       24 0.25         151.   ## 10 English (American) WS       25 0.25         180.   ## # … with 35 more rows ## # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

title: Accessing the Wordbank Database
text: R package accessing Wordbank database.

title: Accessing the Wordbank Database
text: install released version CRAN: install latest development version:
code: install.packages("wordbankr") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("langcog/wordbankr")

title: Accessing the Wordbank Database
text: See instruments (languages forms) available: Get -administration data: Get -item data: Get administration--item data: details, see vignette.
code: instrument <- get_instruments() english_ws_admins <- get_administration_data("English (American)", "WS") all_admins <- get_administration_data() english_ws_items <- get_item_data("English (American)", "WS") all_items <- get_item_data() english_ws_data <- get_instrument_data("English (American)", "WS")

what: Connect to the Wordbank database — connect_to_wordbank
title: Connect to the Wordbank database — connect_to_wordbank
text: Connect Wordbank database

title: Connect to the Wordbank database — connect_to_wordbank
code: connect_to_wordbank(db_args = NULL)

title: Connect to the Wordbank database — connect_to_wordbank
text: db_args List arguments connect wordbank mysql database (host, dbname, user, password).

title: Connect to the Wordbank database — connect_to_wordbank
text: src object connection Wordbank database.

title: Connect to the Wordbank database — connect_to_wordbank
code: # \donttest{ src <- connect_to_wordbank() DBI::dbDisconnect(src) #> [1] TRUE # }

what: Fit age of acquisition estimates for Wordbank data — fit_aoa
title: Fit age of acquisition estimates for Wordbank data — fit_aoa
text: item input data, estimate age acquisition earliest age (months) proportion children understand/produce item greater threshold. proportions used can empirical first smoothed model.

title: Fit age of acquisition estimates for Wordbank data — fit_aoa
code: fit_aoa(   instrument_data,   measure = "produces",   method = "glm",   proportion = 0.5,   age_min = min(instrument_data$age, na.rm = TRUE),   age_max = max(instrument_data$age, na.rm = TRUE) )

title: Fit age of acquisition estimates for Wordbank data — fit_aoa
text: instrument_data data frame returned get_instrument_data, must "age" column "num_item_id" column. measure One "produces" "understands" (defaults "produces"). method string indicating smoothing method use: empirical use empirical proportions,  glm fit logistic linear model, glmrob robust logistic linear model (defaults glm). proportion number 0 1 indicating threshold proportion children. age_min minimum age allow age acquisition. Defaults minimum age instrument_data age_max maximum age allow age acquisition. Defaults maximum age instrument_data

title: Fit age of acquisition estimates for Wordbank data — fit_aoa
text: data frame every row item, item-level columns   input data preserved, aoa column contains age   acquisition estimates.

title: Fit age of acquisition estimates for Wordbank data — fit_aoa
code: # \donttest{ eng_ws_data <- get_instrument_data(language = "English (American)",                                    form = "WS",                                    items = c("item_1", "item_42"),                                    administration_info = TRUE) eng_ws_aoa <- fit_aoa(eng_ws_data) # }

what: Fit quantiles to vocabulary sizes using quantile regression — fit_vocab_quantiles
title: Fit quantiles to vocabulary sizes using quantile regression — fit_vocab_quantiles
text: Fit quantiles vocabulary sizes using quantile regression

title: Fit quantiles to vocabulary sizes using quantile regression — fit_vocab_quantiles
code: fit_vocab_quantiles(vocab_data, measure, group, quantiles = "standard")

title: Fit quantiles to vocabulary sizes using quantile regression — fit_vocab_quantiles
text: vocab_data data frame returned get_administration_data. measure column vocab_data vocabulary values (production comprehension). group (Optional) column vocab_data group . quantiles Either one "standard" (default), "deciles", "quintiles", "quartiles", "median", numeric vector quantile values.

title: Fit quantiles to vocabulary sizes using quantile regression — fit_vocab_quantiles
text: data frame columns "language", "form", "age", group (specified), "quantile", measure, measure   fit vocabulary value quantile age.

title: Fit quantiles to vocabulary sizes using quantile regression — fit_vocab_quantiles
code: # \donttest{ eng_wg <- get_administration_data("English (American)", "WG", include_demographic_info = TRUE) fit_vocab_quantiles(eng_wg, production) #> # A tibble: 55 × 5 #>    language           form    age quantile production #>    <chr>              <chr> <int> <fct>         <dbl> #>  1 English (American) WG        8 0.1       -1.10e+ 0 #>  2 English (American) WG        9 0.1       -8.84e- 1 #>  3 English (American) WG       10 0.1       -4.70e- 1 #>  4 English (American) WG       11 0.1        2.90e-13 #>  5 English (American) WG       12 0.1        5.26e- 1 #>  6 English (American) WG       13 0.1        1.11e+ 0 #>  7 English (American) WG       14 0.1        1.75e+ 0 #>  8 English (American) WG       15 0.1        2.44e+ 0 #>  9 English (American) WG       16 0.1        3.19e+ 0 #> 10 English (American) WG       17 0.1        4.00e+ 0 #> # … with 45 more rows #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows fit_vocab_quantiles(eng_wg, production, sex) #> Error in vars({    {        group    }}): could not find function "vars" fit_vocab_quantiles(eng_wg, production, quantiles = "quartiles") #> # A tibble: 33 × 5 #>    language           form    age quantile production #>    <chr>              <chr> <int> <fct>         <dbl> #>  1 English (American) WG        8 0.25        -0.948  #>  2 English (American) WG        9 0.25        -0.690  #>  3 English (American) WG       10 0.25        -0.0103 #>  4 English (American) WG       11 0.25         1.00   #>  5 English (American) WG       12 0.25         2.34   #>  6 English (American) WG       13 0.25         4.01   #>  7 English (American) WG       14 0.25         6.01   #>  8 English (American) WG       15 0.25         8.35   #>  9 English (American) WG       16 0.25        11.0    #> 10 English (American) WG       17 0.25        14.0    #> # … with 23 more rows #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows # }

what: Get the Wordbank by-administration data — get_administration_data
title: Get the Wordbank by-administration data — get_administration_data
text: Get Wordbank -administration data

title: Get the Wordbank by-administration data — get_administration_data
code: get_administration_data(   language = NULL,   form = NULL,   filter_age = TRUE,   include_demographic_info = FALSE,   include_birth_info = FALSE,   include_health_conditions = FALSE,   include_language_exposure = FALSE,   db_args = NULL )

title: Get the Wordbank by-administration data — get_administration_data
text: language optional string specifying language's administrations retrieve. form optional string specifying form's administrations retrieve. filter_age logical indicating whether filter administrations ones valid age range instrument. include_demographic_info logical indicating whether include child's demographic information (birth_order, ethnicity, race, sex, caregiver_education). include_birth_info logical indicating whether include child's birth information (birth_weight, born_early_or_late, gestational_age, zygosity). include_health_conditions logical indicating whether include child's health condition information (nested dataframe health_conditions column health_condition_name). include_language_exposure logical indicating whether include child's language exposure information time administration (nested dataframe language_exposures columns language, exposure_proportion, age_of_first_exposure). db_args List arguments connect wordbank mysql database (host, dbname, user, password).

title: Get the Wordbank by-administration data — get_administration_data
text: data frame row CDI administration column   variable administration (data_id,  date_of_test, age, comprehension, production,  is_norming), dataset (dataset_name,  dataset_origin_name, language, form,  form_type), information child described   parameter specification.

title: Get the Wordbank by-administration data — get_administration_data
code: # \donttest{ english_ws_admins <- get_administration_data("English (American)", "WS") all_admins <- get_administration_data() # }

what: Get the Wordbank data sources — get_datasets

text: Get Wordbank data sources

title: Get the Wordbank data sources — get_datasets
code: get_datasets(language = NULL, form = NULL, admin_data = FALSE, db_args = NULL)

title: Get the Wordbank data sources — get_datasets
text: language optional string specifying language's datasets retrieve. form optional string specifying form's datasets retrieve. admin_data logical indicating whether include summary-level statistics administrations within dataset. db_args List arguments connect wordbank mysql database (host, dbname, user, password).

title: Get the Wordbank data sources — get_datasets
text: data frame row particular dataset   characteristics: dataset_id, dataset_name,  dataset_origin_name (unique identifier groups datasets   may share children), language, form, form_type,  contributor (contributor name affiliated institution),  citation, license, longitudinal (whether dataset   includes longitudinal participants). Also includes summary statistics   dataset admin_data flag TRUE: number   administrations (n_admins).

title: Get the Wordbank data sources — get_datasets
code: # \donttest{ english_ws_datasets <- get_datasets(language = "English (American)",                                     form = "WS",                                     admin_data = TRUE) # }

what: Get the Wordbank administration-by-item data — get_instrument_data

text: Get Wordbank administration--item data

title: Get the Wordbank administration-by-item data — get_instrument_data
code: get_instrument_data(   language,   form,   items = NULL,   administration_info = FALSE,   item_info = FALSE,   db_args = NULL )

title: Get the Wordbank administration-by-item data — get_instrument_data
text: language string instrument's language (insensitive case whitespace). form string instrument's form (insensitive case whitespace). items character vector column names instrument_table items extract. supplied, defaults columns instrument_table. administration_info Either logical indicating whether include administration data data frame administration data (returned get_administration_data). item_info Either logical indicating whether include item data data frame item data (returned get_item_data). db_args List arguments connect wordbank mysql database (host, dbname, user, password).

title: Get the Wordbank administration-by-item data — get_instrument_data
text: data frame row contains values (value,  produces, understands) given item (item_id)   given administration (data_id), additional columns variables   administration item, specified.

title: Get the Wordbank administration-by-item data — get_instrument_data
code: # \donttest{ eng_ws_data <- get_instrument_data(language = "English (American)",                                    form = "WS",                                    items = c("item_1", "item_42")) # }

title: Get the Wordbank by-item data — get_item_data
text: language optional string specifying language's items retrieve. form optional string specifying form's items retrieve. db_args List arguments connect wordbank mysql database (host, dbname, user, password).

title: Get the Wordbank by-item data — get_item_data
text: data frame row CDI item column   variable : item_id, item_kind (e.g. word, gestures,   word_endings), item_definition, english_gloss,  language, form, form_type, category (meaning-based group shown CDI form), lexical_category,  lexical_class, complexity_category, uni_lemma).

title: Get item-by-age summary statistics — summarise_items
code: summarise_items(item_data, db_args = NULL)

title: Get item-by-age summary statistics — summarise_items
text: item_data dataframe returned get_item_data(). db_args List arguments connect wordbank mysql database (host, dbname, user, password).

title: Get item-by-age summary statistics — summarise_items
text: dataframe row combination item age,   columns summary statistics group: number children   (n_children), means (comprehension, production),   standard deviations (comprehension_sd, production_sd); also   retains item-level variables lang_items (item_id,  item_definition, uni_lemma, lexical_category).

title: Get item-by-age summary statistics — summarise_items
code: # \donttest{ italian_dog <- get_item_data(language = "Italian", form = "WG") %>%   dplyr::filter(uni_lemma == "dog") #> Error in get_item_data(language = "Italian", form = "WG") %>% dplyr::filter(uni_lemma ==     "dog"): could not find function "%>%" italian_dog_summary <- summarise_items(italian_dog) #> Error in unique(item_data$language): object 'italian_dog' not found # }

what: wordbankr: Accessing the Wordbank Database — wordbankr-package
title: wordbankr: Accessing the Wordbank Database — wordbankr-package
text: Tools connecting Wordbank, open repository developmental vocabulary data. information underlying data, see http://wordbank.stanford.edu.

title: wordbankr 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-11-13 new functionality fitting quantiles vocabulary sizes compatibility dplyr 2.0 tidyr 1.0

title: wordbankr 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-14 compatibility tidyeval new functionality metadata data sources new functionality age acquisition estimates new functionality cross-linguistic mapping function argument naming consistency bug fixes performance improvements
